title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message: Hi Guys/Gals, I have a 820-00281 A1707 that is getting 19.91V On ampMeter and 1.2 amps at start up...it has No Video either on Display Or External Display...You can hear the iPhone Charging bling whenever you plug in the Charger but No Video...Also the caps Lock light comes on when fans are spinning...pp3v3_g3H is present (3.3v) PPbus_G3H is also present (12.7V) 2 caps had corrosion C7601, and C7664..Both Were Removed and replaced from a identical Donor board...Any suggestions on Where to start....Thank You in Advance...

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message:
Does the Caps Lock LED react?
Also check USB activity.
You can try new BIOS file.

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message: Hi 2informaticos, And Thank You SO Much for the response...Yes the caps Lock Led does respond to being Pressed (Light goes on and off When Pressed)...There is No USB Activity as I tried with a USB Mouse and also Tried a USB Keyboard for a PRAM reset but no go...ANY help is GREATLY Appreciated :)

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message:
Board is runing, if you get Caps Lock reaction.
No USB activity and no internal/external video at same time, is very strange in this case.
All USB ports the same?
Check them all for activity.

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message: All USB ports Give the same Values with the USB-C AmpMeter Plugged into them...Fans Spin with each USB port Plugged in...and Caps Lock Responds with each one also

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message: But no Light on USB Mouse, KeyBoard or even External Drive when Plugged in toUSB Ports....

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message: Are there any Particular Lines I can Check?...Sorry...These Boards are CRAZY with all these USB Controller Chips!!!...LOL

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message:
Did you checked all your S0 rails ? If you have PPVCC_S0_CPU normaly it should be OK.
Is your CPU over heating ? 
Plus you can hear the charging boing this is weird....

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message: Have Not checked S0 Rails Yet...CPU is Pretty Hot when fans are spinning...And Yes I can hear the Boing when the USB-C Is plugged into the Machine. Even when the fans are spinning while on Battery and the charger gets plugged in Machine makes the Boing Sound...Which S0 Rails should I check?

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message: Thank You Bouba148...PPVCC_S0_CPU is reading 1.2V while machine is running...

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message: Do you have another good screen to try ?

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message:
Yes I do have another Screen. Also...Here are Some S0 Rails I just Measured...(With Fans Spinning and Charger Attached...

PP5V_S0 = 5.1V
PP3V3_S0 = 3.3V
PP3V3_S0_GPU = 0.00V
PP1V8_S0 = 1.79V
PPCC_S0_CPU = 1.2V

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message: Also just tested PPVCORE_S0_GPU READING  -0.000

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message: Does Anyone have any Suggestions??

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message: If someone has similar board, with dedicated GPU, maybe can post if GPU VCORE appears directly on the boot.

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message: Could there be a Short on one of the GPU Power Lines? I feel SOOOO Close!!!...LOL

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message: Maybe a gpu_enable line??

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message: Anyone Have ay ideas??

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message:
Could be bad GPU.
But you need to confirm in a similar board if GPU gets power at boot time.

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message: Okay...I do have another 820-00281 Board that also doesn?t turn on...No Liquid damage but gets 19.89V on USB-C Amp-meter but goes from 11amps to 61amps then back to 61Amps and just keeps doing that No warmth on the board anywhere...Any Suggestions on getting that Board To power on?...Any Help is GREATLY APPRECIATED ?

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message:
[LIST=1]
[*]Sorry...Just goes from 10-11Amps then 69-61amps and repeats itself like it trying to start up but doesn?t...Any Suggestions
[/LIST]

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message: Anyone have any Suggestions? :(

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message:
3V3_G3H, PPBUS_G3H, any other voltage on this other board?
Check tge basic things and post correct information.
You may want to say 11mA, 0.11A, or 0.061A, no idea really; but impossible to get 10-69A for sure...

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message: For sure ! Your board would already be fried , and you with it..... Not possible as your charger is providing something like 4.3A max if it's ? 87W charger

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message: Yes...Sorry...I Meant its reading 19.89V and just keeps going from 10mA - 61mA on USB-C Meter

title: 820-00281-A A1707 with No Chime Or Display But Fans Spin
message:
You should post basic power on signals.
We need some info to help.
Check if PPBUS_G3H and 3V42 are stable.
3V3_S5/SUS, PM_RSMRST_L, PM_PWRBTN_L reaction triggering SMC_ONOFF_L, etc...
Also try starting in SMC bypass mode.
